title: Calories in 1 Crab Rangoon
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 crab rangoon, including full nutrition breakdown with carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Fried wonton wrapper filled with imitation crab, cream cheese, and green onions; standard appetizer size (~35 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand of ingredients, frying method, and portion size. Check restaurant or package labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One crab rangoon has about 100 kcal, with 6 g fat and 10 g carbs from the crispy wrapper.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use real crab instead of imitation

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 crab rangoon?
faqs.a: Approximately 100 kcal for a standard fried crab rangoon.

faqs.q: What are the macros for crab rangoon?
faqs.a: About 10 g carbs, 3 g protein, 6 g fat per piece.

faqs.q: Is crab rangoon high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 200 mg sodium per crab rangoon due to seasonings and wrappers.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in crab rangoon?
faqs.a: Bake instead of frying to reduce fat and calories by about 40 kcal per piece.

faqs.q: Does crab rangoon have much protein?
faqs.a: Only about 3 g protein per piece, mostly from the crab filling.
